properties.name: The 7 Principles of Conflict Resolution
properties.type: The 7 Principles of Conflict Resolution : How to resolve disputes, defuse difficult situations and reach agreement
properties.facts: 7 Principles of Conflict Resolution is the go-to resource for conflict and dispute resolution, whether you're new to the subject or an experienced practitioner.
properties.imageCaption: The 7 Principles of Conflict Resolution - Louisa Weinstein

properties.name: Pedagogy of the Oppressed
properties.type: Pedagogy of the Oppressed : 50th Anniversary Edition
properties.facts: First published in Portuguese in 1968, Pedagogy of the Oppressed was translated and published in English in 1970. Paulo Freire's work has helped to empower countless people throughout the world and has taken on special urgency in the United States and Western Europe, where the creation of a permanent underclass among the underprivileged and minorities in cities and urban centers is ongoing.
properties.imageCaption: Pedagogy of the Oppressed -  Paulo Freire

properties.name: Mediation and Conflict Resolution
properties.type: Mediation and Conflict Resolution: Managing Conflict in the Workplace A Hands-Ons Approach for Managers
properties.facts: Mediation. Managing conflict in the workplace. A hands on approach.
properties.imageCaption: Mediation and Conflict Resolution - Allen May

properties.name: The Mediation Handbook
properties.type: The Mediation Handbook: Research, theory, and practice
properties.facts: The Handbook of Mediation gathers leading experts across fields related to peace, justice, human rights, and conflict resolution to explore ways that mediation can be applied to a range of spectrums, including new age settings, relationships, organizations, institutions, communities, environmental conflicts, and intercultural and international conflicts.

properties.name: Say What's Wrong and Make It Right
properties.type: Say What's Wrong and Make It Right: Proven Strategies for Teaching Children to Resolve Conflicts on Their Own (English Edition)
properties.facts: Parents, Grandparents, Childcare Givers, Counselors, Educators, even Business Leaders... Do you wish for greater peace in your world? Are you looking for a way to build independent, communicative, caring, problem-solving individuals on their way to becoming successful, happy, contributing members of society? If so, you are going to love Say Whatâ€™s Wrong and Make It Right.
properties.imageCaption: Say What's Wrong and Make It Right - Karen Taylor-Bleiker

properties.name: Resolving Structural Conflicts
properties.type: Resolving Structural Conflicts: How Violent Systems Can Be Transformed
properties.facts: This book analyses how certain types of social systems generate violent conflict and discusses how these systems can be transformed in order to create the conditions for positive peace.
properties.imageCaption: Resolving Structural Conflicts - Richard E. Rubenstein

properties.name: Resolving Everyday Conflict
properties.facts: In Resolving Everyday Conflict, Sande distills his message to the essentials, quickly equipping readers with the tools they need to bring peace to their relationships.
properties.imageCaption: Resolving Everyday Conflict - Ken Sande and Kevin Johnson

properties.name: Nonviolent Communication: A Language of Life
properties.type: Nonviolent Communication: A Language of Life, 3rd Edition: Life-Changing Tools for Healthy Relationships
properties.facts: Nonviolent Communication is the integration of four things: Consciousness: a set of principles that support living a life of compassion, collaboration, courage, and authenticity. Language: understanding how words contribute to connection or distance. Communication: knowing how to ask for what we want, how to hear others even in disagreement, and how to move toward solutions that work for all. Means of influence: sharing 'power with others' rather than using 'power over others'
properties.imageCaption: Nonviolent Communication - Marshall B. Rosenberg and Deepak Chopra
